articles.title: Understanding EPA: The Most Important NFL Stat You've Never Heard Of
articles.excerpt: Expected Points Added (EPA) is revolutionizing how we analyze football. Learn how this advanced metric works and why it's more predictive than traditional stats.
articles.content:
What is EPA?

Expected Points Added (EPA) measures the value of each play in terms of how it changes a team's expected points. Unlike yards or touchdowns, EPA accounts for context - a 5-yard gain on 3rd and 10 is worth less than a 5-yard gain on 3rd and 3.

Why EPA Matters

EPA is the foundation of modern NFL analytics. It helps us understand which plays truly matter and which players are making the biggest impact on the field.
